nodes.name: Identity

nodes.documentation: @dev Constructor.

@dev Owner of this contract, in the Foundation sense.
We do not allow this to be used externally,
since a contract could fake ownership.
In other contracts, you have to call the Foundation to
know the real owner of this contract.
nodes.name: identityOwner

nodes.documentation:
@dev Check in Foundation if msg.sender is the owner of this contract.
Same remark.
nodes.name: isIdentityOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev Modifier version of isIdentityOwner.
nodes.name: onlyIdentityOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev Owner functions require open Vault in token.
nodes.name: isActiveIdentityOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev Modifier version of isActiveOwner.
nodes.name: onlyActiveIdentityOwner

nodes.documentation: @dev Does this contract owner have an open Vault in the token?
nodes.name: isActiveIdentity

nodes.documentation:
@dev Does msg.sender have an ERC 725 key with certain purpose,
and does the contract owner have an open Vault in the token?
nodes.name: hasIdentityPurpose

nodes.documentation: @dev Modifier version of hasKeyForPurpose
nodes.name: onlyIdentityPurpose
identityboxSendtext

nodes.documentation:
@dev "Send" a "file" to this contract.
File should be encrypted on this contract asymetricEncryptionPublicKey,
before upload on decentralized file storage,
before submitting a TX here.
nodes.name: identityboxSendfile

nodes.documentation: @dev Blacklist an address in this Identity box.
nodes.name: identityboxBlacklist

nodes.documentation: @dev Unblacklist.
nodes.name: identityboxUnblacklist

nodes.documentation: @title Interface with clones or inherited contracts.
nodes.name: IdentityInterface
